alert.note: Alert for Larimer (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 29 at 12:50PM MDT until July 29 at 3:45PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: The National Weather Service in Denver has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Larimer County in north central Colorado... * Until 345 PM MDT. * At 1250 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 0.4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.4 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding in the southern portions of the Cameron Peak burn area. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, roads, and low lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... the southern portions of the Cameron Peak burn area near Glen Haven in Central Larimer County This includes the following additional locations... The Retreat and Storm Mountain. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. THIS IS A LIFE THREATENING SITUATION! Heavy Rainfall will cause extensive and severe flooding of creeks, streams, roads and culverts in the affected part of the Cameron Peak burn area. This includes the slopes along the North Fork of the Big Thompson and Miller Fork. Rock slides or debris flows can also be expected across roads in the warning area.
